text:
jk2 does not process Jk directives in httpd.conf.  I have been trying to pass
env vars between apache and tomcat with JkEnvVar directive in httpd.conf without
success using jk2.  I cannot get any of the Jk directives to work.  For any of
the Jk directives I receive errors such as this:
Syntax error on line 1106 of /usr/local/apache2/conf/httpd.conf:
Invalid command 'JkEnvVar', perhaps mis-spelled or defined by a module not
included in the server configuration

I am using Apache 2.0.43 and built jk2 2.0.2 locally.
creator: grenoml@yahoo.com
trawick@apache.org
text:
wrong product for tomcat connectors; unless you have a reason for thinking that
this is an Apache bug, please change the product to one of the Tomcat entries

the error message makes it look like the module implementing JkEnvVar is not loaded

do you have a LoadModule directive present for that module prior to the point
where the directive is specified?

Changing product to Tomcat.

Gerry Reno
creator: grenoml@yahoo.com

text:
JkEnvVar is a mod_jk configuration option, not a mod_jk2 configuration option.  
The mod_jk2 configuration is completely different from mod_jk (so, in 
particular most of the mod_jk directives aren't supported).  Please review the 
mod_jk2 documentation for how to configure.
creator: william.barker@wilshire.com
grenoml@yahoo.com
text:
William,
  I have looked at the jk2 documentation and cannot find how to pass an
environment variable.   Can you tell me how I do this using jk2?

thx,
Gerry Reno
